AVSEC Order  No.16/2011 
 
Subject:-  National Civil Aviation Security  Quality Control Programme. 
 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification 
No. 1797, dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security(Civil Aviation), for the 
purpose of  securing the aircraft operations and access  control at the  civil  
airports in India directs that: 
 
(i) 
The National Civil Aviation Security Quality Control Programme, 
which has been formulated  to comply with the  requirements  of  
Standards  3.4.1 to 3.4.8 of  Annex-17 to  the  Convention on 
International Civil Aviation, shall be implemented by all agencies 
connected  with civil aviation security in  India. 
 
(ii) 
The Aviation Security Quality Control Programme shall be prepared 
on the template given at Annexure-I by each Airport Operator, 
Aircraft 
Operator, 
Regulated 
Agent, 
Catering 
Companies, 
Concessionaires, Ground Handling Agencies and other  agencies  
whose  security programme has been approved   by the  BCAS.  
 
(iii) 
The relevant  provisions of quality control given in standards 3.4.1 to 
3.4.8 Annex 17 to the Convention on International Civil Aviation and  
all the aspects mentioned  in the  BCAS letter of even  no. dated 2nd  
Feb. 2005 (copy enclosed) shall be incorporated in the Quality 
Control Programme by the  respective agencies.

Sir,

Please refer to AVSEC Order No,6/2004 Dated 21.12.04 regarding
National Civil Aviation Quality control Programme. The Quality Control
Programme inter-alia includes the following aspects of aviation security.

1. The Quality Control programme is comprised of the structure,
responsibility, process and procedures that promote and establish an
environment and culture of continuing improvement and entiancement of
aviation security. The programme will be a written document. It will have
a structure that starts at the executive level as corporate policy and
finishes with ensuring that those persons tasked with carrying out security
duties do so effectively.

2. A further purpose is to provide all persons, assigned aviation security
duties or responsibilities, with directions for effective application of. AVSEC.
controls or measures. The aim should be not only to conform with the
requirements of Annex-17, but also more importantly, to prevent acts of
unfawful interference. .

3. The objectives of Quality Control Programme may interalia include the
following aspects of. Aviation Security.

(i) verify the effective implementation of security controls;

(i) monitor the level of compliance with the provisions of the Aircraft
operator, Airport operator / caterers AVSEC programme,

(iii) | determine effectiveness of the security programme approved by the
Commissioner through regular inspections ‘and audits in the area of
their jurisdiction;

(iv) ensure all persons who are assigned duties or responsibilities are
verifiably trained and certified wherever necessary and instructed to
carry out such duties with due care and caution.
